# gunÃ»
gunÃ» is an ubiquitous ligature sign modification adding four vertical or horizontal strokes:  

ğ’¦ â‹ ğ’€¾ â‹ ğ’‘“ â‹ [ğ’†¦](ğ’†¦.html) â‹ ğ’© â‹ gunÃ» â‡” ğ’‹— Å¡u ğ’‘• ğ’‘‘ ğ’€¼ ğ’ˆ› ğ’‰£ â‡” [Å¡eÅ¡ig](Å¡eÅ¡ig.html) [tenu](tenu.html) [nutillu](nutillu.html) ğ’ˆ   

ğ’‰£ nuÄ â‰ˆ Äun in gunu ğ’‡ğ’‰£ paragon = diagonal  

e.g. ğ’…† => ğ’…Š  

ğ’™ 'gunu' / ğ’Šº Å E-'gunu' => [Å¡eÅ¡ig](Å¡eÅ¡ig.html)  ğ’Œ¨ =>	ğ’Œª  

gunu especially in its form of ğ’™ ğ’Šº ğ’‘ may be related to [ğ’‰†](ğ’‰†.html) NAM, phonetically as ablaut marker?
ğ’„Šğ’€´ Å¡akanâ‚† Ø­ÙØ§ÙƒÙÙ… Ë¢á¸¥Äkim "governor" => ğ’‰†ğ’„Šğ’€´ NAM Å¡akanâ‚† â‰ˆ Ø­ÙÙƒÙ’Ù…ÙØ© Ë¢hukmah "governorship"

# mesh gunu
In [Proto-Cuneiform](Proto-Cuneiform.html) and in [Elamite](Elamite.html) gunu was often [realized as a mesh](https://www.unicode.org/L2/L2020/20193-proto-cuneiform.pdf) similar to  
ğ’†œ kaskal  
ğœ¤ ğœ¦ ğœ§ in ğœ“µ ğœ¯ ğœ°  
ğœ“… ğœš ğœ• ğœ” ğœ– ğœ™ ğœ˜ ğœ’¤  
ğœ’¥ ğœ‘¤ ğœ‘¦ ğœ‘¨ ğœ‘¥ ğœ‘§?  
ğœ“ƒ ğœ‘† ğœ‘‡ ğœ‘ˆ ğœ‘…  
ğœ˜ ğœº  
ğœ  ğœ¿ ğœ½  
ğœ¢ ğœ€ ğœ¾  
ğœ¡ ğœ£ hal  
ğœ° ğœ ğœ¯ ğœ’ ğœ± ğœ²  
ğœ“š ğœ¶ ğœ·  

Identified variants of ğœ¯ ğœ± ğœ indicate that dots were (sometimes?) used as old gunu.  

Not commonly counted as gunu forms:  
[ğ’…‹](ğ’…‹.html) â‰ˆ ğ’Œˆ â‰ˆ ğ’€§ 
[ğ’€§](ğ’€§.html) IL â‰ˆ ğ’€  AL â‹… Å E ğ’Šº 
[ğ’Šº](ğ’Šº.html) Å E ğ’‘

[ğ’Œ§](ğ’Œ§.html) â‰ˆ ğ’Œ¦Â·ğ’¦

# Semantic significance ? [causative](causative.html) ?
Gunification = add gunu to sign to modify/intensify/derive meaning:  

ğ’…† IGI Auge eye  
ğ’…Š IGI{GUNU} be bright, shine, see  

ğ’ƒ¸ GAN tenu < ğ’ƒ· GAN [gunu](gunu.html) < ğ’ƒ° GAN
